content: Restoration after Exile
Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! says the .

Therefore thus says the , the God of Israel, concerning the shepherds who shepherd my people: It is you who have scattered my flock, and have driven them away, and you have not attended to them. So I will attend to you for your evil doings, says the .
Then I myself will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the lands where I have driven them, and I will bring them back to their fold, and they shall be fruitful and multiply.
I will raise up shepherds over them who will shepherd them, and they shall not fear any longer, or be dismayed, nor shall any be missing, says the .
The Righteous Branch of David
The days are surely coming, says the , when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal wisely, and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.
In his days Judah will be saved and Israel will live in safety. And this is the name by which he will be called: “The  is our righteousness.”
Therefore, the days are surely coming, says the , when it shall no longer be said, “As the  lives who brought the people of Israel up out of the land of Egypt,”

but “As the  lives who brought out and led the offspring of the house of Israel out of the land of the north and out of all the lands where he had driven them.” Then they shall live in their own land.
False Prophets of Hope Denounced
Concerning the prophets:
My heart is crushed within me,
I have become like a drunkard,
because of the
For the land is full of adulterers;
Their course has been evil,
Both prophet and priest are ungodly;
Therefore their way shall be to them
for I will bring disaster upon them
In the prophets of Samaria
they prophesied by Baal
But in the prophets of Jerusalem
they commit adultery and walk in lies;
all of them have become like Sodom to me,
Therefore thus says the  of hosts concerning the prophets:
“I am going to make them eat wormwood,
for from the prophets of Jerusalem
Thus says the  of hosts: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you; they are deluding you. They speak visions of their own minds, not from the mouth of the .
They keep saying to those who despise the word of the , “It shall be well with you”; and to all who stubbornly follow their own stubborn hearts, they say, “No calamity shall come upon you.”
Am I a God near by, says the , and not a God far off?
Who can hide in secret places so that I cannot see them? says the . Do I not fill heaven and earth? says the .
I have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy lies in my name, saying, “I have dreamed, I have dreamed!”
How long? Will the hearts of the prophets ever turn back—those who prophesy lies, and who prophesy the deceit of their own heart?
They plan to make my people forget my name by their dreams that they tell one another, just as their ancestors forgot my name for Baal.
Let the prophet who has a dream tell the dream, but let the one who has my word speak my word faithfully. What has straw in common with wheat? says the .
Is not my word like fire, says the , and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?
See, therefore, I am against the prophets, says the , who steal my words from one another.
See, I am against the prophets, says the , who use their own tongues and say, “Says the .”

See, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams, says the , and who tell them, and who lead my people astray by their lies and their recklessness, when I did not send them or appoint them; so they do not profit this people at all, says the .
When this people, or a prophet, or a priest asks you, “What is the burden of the ?” you shall say to them, “You are the burden, and I will cast you off, says the .”
And as for the prophet, priest, or the people who say, “The burden of the ,” I will punish them and their households.
Thus shall you say to one another, among yourselves, “What has the  answered?” or “What has the  spoken?”
But “the burden of the ” you shall mention no more, for the burden is everyone’s own word, and so you pervert the words of the living God, the  of hosts, our God.
Thus you shall ask the prophet, “What has the  answered you?” or “What has the  spoken?”
But if you say, “the burden of the ,” thus says the : Because you have said these words, “the burden of the ,” when I sent to you, saying, You shall not say, “the burden of the ,”
therefore, I will surely lift you up and cast you away from my presence, you and the city that I gave to you and your ancestors.
And I will bring upon you everlasting disgrace and perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.
